prompts.user_prompt:
Task: Extract up to k triples that are directly supported by the text. You may paraphrase, but you must quote the evidence substrings.

    Requirements
    - Extract triples [subject, relation, object] that are explicitly supported by the text.
    - For any triple that instantiates an ontology relation (i.e., its relation label appears in the ontology),
      enforce domain→range consistency: the subject_type must match the relation’s domain concept, and
      the object_type must match the relation’s range concept.
    - You may also output factual triples that do NOT correspond to any ontology relation; in that case,
      choose the most appropriate subject_type and object_type concept labels from the ontology, but do not discard the triple.
    - Return JSON only, with this schema
        {
          "triples": [
            {
              "triple": ["subject","relation","object"],
              "subject_type": "Concept",
              "object_type": "Concept",
              "support": "exact quote from text",
              "confidence": 0.0
            }
          ]
        }
    - The confidence must be a real value between 0 and 1, estimated by how clearly the text supports the triple,
      and how well subject_type and object_type match the ontology types.



One-shot EXAMPLE (for guidance; do not copy the text):
Example sentence:
"The number of staff members at the University of Burgundy is 2900."

Example triples (bare triples just to show what facts should emerge):

- YOUR OUTPUT MUST follow the full schema described below
  (with subject_type, object_type, support, and confidence in [0,1]).
- Do not copy the example text; extract from the actual Text section only.

Task: Extract up to k triples that are directly supported by the text. You may paraphrase, but you must quote the evidence substrings.

    Requirements
    - Extract triples [subject, relation, object] that are explicitly supported by the text.
    - For any triple that instantiates an ontology relation (i.e., its relation label appears in the ontology),
      enforce domain→range consistency: the subject_type must match the relation’s domain concept, and
      the object_type must match the relation’s range concept.
    - You may also output factual triples that do NOT correspond to any ontology relation; in that case,
      choose the most appropriate subject_type and object_type concept labels from the ontology, but do not discard the triple.
    - Return JSON only, with this schema
        {
          "triples": [
            {
              "triple": ["subject","relation","object"],
              "subject_type": "Concept",
              "object_type": "Concept",
              "support": "exact quote from text",
              "confidence": 0.0
            }
          ]
        }
    - The confidence must be a real value between 0 and 1, estimated by how clearly the text supports the triple,
      and how well subject_type and object_type match the ontology types.



One-shot EXAMPLE (for guidance; do not copy the text):
Example sentence:
"The Accademia di Architettura di Mendrisio has 100 academic staff and 600 students. Its dean is called Mario Botta."

Example triples (bare triples just to show what facts should emerge):
[["Accademia di Architettura di Mendrisio", "dean", "Mario Botta"], ["Accademia di Architettura di Mendrisio", "numberOfStudents", "600"], ["Accademia di Architettura di Mendrisio", "academicStaffSize", "100"]]

NOTE:
- The example triples above are simplified bare triples.
- YOUR OUTPUT MUST follow the full schema described below
  (with subject_type, object_type, support, and confidence in [0,1]).
- Do not copy the example text; extract from the actual Text section only.

    Text
    "Acharya Institute of Technology has an academic staff of 500. It is located in India and its motto is \"Nurturing Excellence\"."

    Ontology concepts
    University, Person, Sport, City, Religion, Colour, Organization, State, Country, Campus, EthnicGroup, Anthem, Saint, Place, Department, Faculty, School, College, Laboratory, Library, Program, Degree, Language, Mascot, Date

    Ontology relations (domain → range)
    - director(University,Person)
- sportsOffered(University,Sport)
- latinName(University,string)
- numberOfPostgraduateStudents(University,number)
- established(University,date)
- foundingDate(University,date)
- dissolvedDate(University,date)
- closedDate(University,date)
- accreditationDate(University,date)
- renamedDate(University,date)
- mergerDate(University,date)
- firstGraduatingClassDate(University,date)
- charterGrantDate(University,date)
- headquarter(University,City)
- location(University,Place)
- city(University,City)
- state(University,State)
- country(University,Country)
- religion(University,Religion)
- postalCode(University,string)
- motto(University,string)
- nickname(University,string)
- longName(University,string)
- affiliation(University,Organization)
- wasGivenTheTechnicalCampusStatusBy(University,Organization)
- patronSaint(University,Saint)
- anthem(University,Anthem)
- numberOfStudents(University,number)
- numberOfUndergraduateStudents(University,number)
- numberOfDoctoralStudents(University,number)
- academicStaffSize(University,number)
- administrativeStaffSize(University,number)
- staff(University,number)
- leader(University,Person)
- leaderTitle(University,string)
- president(University,Person)
- rector(University,Person)
- dean(University,Person)
- chancellor(University,Person)
- viceChancellor(University,Person)
- provost(University,Person)
- founder(University,Person)
- endowment(University,number)

- abbreviation(University,string)
- mottoLanguage(University,Language)
- officialSchoolColour(University,Colour)

- campusType(University,string)

- parentOrganization(University,Organization)
- studentsUnion(University,Organization)
- sportsGoverningBody(University,Organization)
- sportsClub(University,Organization)
- sports(University,Sport)
- mascot(University,Mascot)
- hasDepartment(University,Department)
- hasFaculty(University,Faculty)
- hasSchool(University,School)
- hasCollege(University,College)
- hasLaboratory(University,Laboratory)
- hasLibrary(University,Library)
- offersProgram(University,Program)
- offersDegree(University,Degree)
- outlookRanking(University,number)

    Constraints
    - Extract ALL clearly stated factual triples in the text (not just those that match ontology relations).
    - Do not discard a triple solely because it does not match any ontology relation; instead,
      assign the best-fitting subject_type and object_type concepts you can infer from the ontology.
    - For triples whose relation label appears in the ontology, respect the domain and range for subject_type and object_type.
    - Always extract any explicit date, time, or year mentioned in the text as part of a factual triple when relevant.
    - Resolve pronouns to the nearest valid antecedent if needed to form a correct triple.
    - Do not invent entities that are not mentioned in the text.
    - Output MUST be valid JSON and nothing else.

triples.support: It has an academic staff of 500.
It is located in India.
its motto is "Nurturing Excellence"
No specific color is mentioned for the institute.
